name: Marie Curie
brief_description: Renowned physicist and chemist, a pioneer in the study of radioactivity and the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.

name: Rosalind Franklin
famous_discovery: Contribution to the understanding of DNA structure
brief_description: X-ray crystallographer who made significant contributions to the discovery of the DNA double helix.

name: Ada Lovelace
famous_discovery: Considered the world's first computer programmer
brief_description: Mathematician and writer known for her work on Charles Babbage's early mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine.

name: Jane Goodall
famous_discovery: Pioneering work on the behavior of wild chimpanzees
brief_description: Primatologist and ethologist renowned for her extensive research on the lives of wild chimpanzees in Tanzania.

name: Barbara McClintock
brief_description: Geneticist who made groundbreaking discoveries about the mobile genetic elements in corn.

name: Hypatia of Hypatia
famous_discovery: Contributions to mathematics, astronomy, and philosophy
brief_description: Ancient Greek mathematician, astronomer, and philosopher who made significant contributions to various fields.

name: Chien-Shiung Wu
famous_discovery: Experimental proof of the theory of parity violation
brief_description: Experimental physicist who played a pivotal role in the field of nuclear physics.

name: Emmy Noether
brief_description: Mathematician renowned for her groundbreaking contributions to abstract algebra and theoretical physics.

name: Grace Hopper
famous_discovery: Development of the first compiler for a computer programming language
brief_description: Computer scientist and U.S. Navy rear admiral known for her pioneering work in computer science and programming languages.

name: Dorothy Crowfoot Hodgkin
famous_discovery: Determination of the structures of important biochemical substances
brief_description: Chemist who won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for her work on the structure of important biochemical compounds.

name: Rita Levi-Montalcini
brief_description: Neurobiologist who received the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for her work on NGF and its role in nerve cell development.

name: Katherine Johnson
famous_discovery: Mathematical calculations for NASA's early space missions
brief_description: African American mathematician and physicist whose calculations were crucial for NASA's early space missions.

name: Rachel Carson
famous_discovery: Pioneering work in environmental science and conservation
brief_description: Biologist, writer, and environmentalist known for her influential book 'Silent Spring' and her efforts in raising awareness about environmental issues.

name: Mae Jemison
famous_discovery: First African American woman in space
brief_description: Astronaut, physician, and engineer who became the first African American woman to travel in space.

name: Hedy Lamarr
famous_discovery: Invention of a frequency-hopping spread spectrum communication technology
brief_description: Actress and inventor who developed a groundbreaking technology used in secure communication systems.

name: Gerty Cori
famous_discovery: Discovery of the Cori cycle and her work on glycogen metabolism
brief_description: Biochemist and first woman to win the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for her research on carbohydrate metabolism.

name: Ruzena Bajcsy
famous_discovery: Contributions to computer science, artificial intelligence, and robotics
brief_description: Computer scientist and engineer known for her pioneering work in the fields of robotics and artificial intelligence.

name: Gertrude B. Elion
famous_discovery: Development of drugs for leukemia, gout, and herpes
brief_description: Biochemist and pharmacologist who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for her groundbreaking work in drug development.

name: Temple Grandin
famous_discovery: Innovative work in animal science and autism advocacy
brief_description: Autistic scientist, author, and advocate known for her contributions to animal science and her work in raising awareness about autism.
